body:
I mean, gomobile, as a command, doesn't require Go 1.5 features
to build, right?

at gomobile init time, if it detects that the user doesn't have Go 1.5
or higher, it can download go tip and compile. Relying on the user to
compile Go 1.5 for gomobile is probably too much work for them, esp.
because the targeted audience is mobile app developer, not necessarily
a user that follows Go development itself closely.

It can also detect if Go 1.5 is released, and if it's, offer the user a
way to use prebuilt binary distributions from https://golang.org/dl.
